data.title: Captain Lawrence Surridge
data.meta_description: The Kincardine Independent - The premier news publication for the Municipality of Kincardine, Ontario
data.text:
CPT. LAWRENCE SURRIDGE

Captain Lawrence Robert Surridge of Owen Sound passed away peacefully at Grey Bruce Health Services – Owen Sound, on Monday, June 22, 2020, at the age of 85.

Beloved husband of Irene Surridge (née Ford) for 65 years.

Loving father of RSM Lawrence Surridge Jr. (Carla) of Owen Sound, Bob Surridge (Carolyn) of Kincardine, MWO Ken Surridge (Reta) of Wiarton, Susanne Gunn (Brad) of Owen Sound and Michael Surridge (Alison) of Owen Sound.

Cherished Grandpa of Nicole (Jason), Crayton (Leanne), Courtney, Jordyn, Tina, Shane, Justin (Crystal), Cally, Taylor and Kendra (Greg); and Great-Grandpa of Brittany, Amy, Rowan, Flora, Grace and Austin.

Dear brother of Keith Surridge (Jean), Eleanor Thompson, Bob Surridge (Pat) and Irene Fobert (Bernie), and brother-in-law of Edna Surridge, Sandy Davis (Moe Smith), Ken Ford (Barb), Larry Ford (Louise) and Jean Ford.

Lawrence will also be missed by many nieces, nephews and friends.

Predeceased by his parents, James and Christena Surridge (née Kinmond); parents-in-law Victor and Evelyn Ford; siblings Annabelle Buchanan (Hugh), Mary Stewart (Eldon), Mervin Surridge, David and James Surridge (in infancy) and siblings-in-law Grace Surridge, Sheila Surridge, Ron Thompson, Wayne Burrows, Victor Ford, Bill Ford, Roy Ford (Arlee), Robert Ford (Lee), Percy Ford and Eric Davis.

He was born in Kincardine on May 29, 1935. Captain Lawrence sailed the Great Lakes for over 40 years. He loved sports, especially hockey, and was a “die-hard” Leafs fan until they traded Frank Mahovlich. Lawrence enjoyed many rounds of golf over the years, playing with his sons, grandchildren, family and friends. In his retirement he opened and enjoyed operating Surridge’s Golf Club Repair and Skate Sharpening. He was a Legion Branch 6 member, where he loved to work in the kitchen with the ladies.

Lawrence and Irene loved to travel and he was always keen to find a casino to spend some time in. He was very proud of his family and always enjoyed spending time with them.

Due to the COVID-19 restrictions, a private funeral service was held at the Brian E. Wood Funeral Home in Owen Sound at 11 a.m. on Saturday, June 27, 2020.

Interment followed at Greenwood Cemetery, Owen Sound.

As expressions of sympathy, memorial donations to the Owen Sound Legion – Branch 6, the Canadian Cancer Society, the Trillium Gift of Life Network or the Crohn’s and Colitis Foundation would be appreciated.

View Lawrence’s funeral service online by visiting his memorial at www.woodfuneralhome.ca. Arrangements entrusted to Brian E. Wood Funeral Home, 250-14th Street West, Owen Sound N4K 3X8; 519-376-7492.
